challengeName: (F2F) IBM - SiBM - ClipStreamer UI Prototype Updates
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to the (F2F) IBM - SiBM - ClipStreamer UI Prototype Updates! The goal of this challenge is to make the required updates to the provided responsive HTML5 Prototype . The prototype must follow our standards and our guidelines. Review the details below.

As part of this challenge we need you to document your HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript code (using best practices). We are looking for a clear explanation of the code to allow us the ability to quickly update and integrate with future development. We will allow documentation updates during final fixes (but still required).

Tips for Success: Asking questions early and getting Copilot or PM's feedback is very important for the success of this challenge.

Competition Task Overview:
The main task of this competition is to develop an HTML5 prototype based on the provided storyboard designs. Your prototype must work properly in all the required browsers.

Key Requirements:
- We would like you to use bootstrap.
- Test in all the required browsers (see the list below)
- Ensure your submission is clear of HTML and CSS Validation errors and warnings.
- You are provided with a wireframe and storyboards.
- Screens/layout in wireframes and storyboards might be different, wherever the screens/layout are different, storyboards takes precedence - please follow that! (Wireframe should be helpful with the flow).

Documentation:
- Prototype - which you need to use as the base
- Few Reference Images

Required Updates:
A. Specific changes for Desktop:
1) On clicking "View All" shown at the bottom of the screen, will load all the snippets and note after all snippets are loaded change the text once to "Viewing 1 to 100 of 100", no need to load 100 snippets instead for demo purpose just add few snippets and we don't need to initiate the loading of more snippets when the user reaches the bottom of the page after the "View All" has been clicked because it is with the assumption all snippets has already been loaded.
1.1) We also need a fix specific to "View More" in notifications but we will clarify the required fix in final fixes!

2) Photo snippets (purpule color snippets, for example 4th snippet and any other similar snippets in the prototype), clicking on a picture thumbnail should display the full image either in a modal window or its upto you on how you show this!
- Feel free to replace the current image with the attached stock photo.
- In mobile / tablet view, clicking on the image snippet should show the image in full screen (landscape)!

3) UNDO:
Reference: 04_undo.png
In the main content (list of snippets), currently on mouse hover in a snippet and when user clicks on delete (X) icon, we show the confirmation dialog, but we would like you to not show that delete confirmation, instead we need this interaction:
- Remove the snippet content (text, URL, photo, etc)
- Show an empty snippet placeholder like the attached image with an UNDO link
- When user clicks on "UNDO" link, we need to show the snippet back again
- If the user didn't click on "UNDO" then fade out the snippet placeholder within a few seconds.
(Make sure to implement this for Mobile and tablet as well)

4) When using the multi-select option, if I select a few at the top, then scroll down... 
a) It is very slow to scroll
b) I'm unable to check lower items (I can hit the check circle but it does not select the snippet) - please allow users to select an item/snippet.
c) Tagging as favorites (selecting and clicking on star icon) in the multi-select should show the star icon to each of the snippet that was selected (select the star icon for an individual snippet to see where the star is shown when favorites is clicked).

5) Clicking on "Select" or "Search" shown to the left of "+ New Snippet" displays the flyout but it should not overlap with the snippets below that....so, when we click on these actions...snippets should always be displayed below these flyouts. 
(Make sure to implement this for Mobile and tablet as well)

6) On desktop, dragging and dropping a file type (text, image, URL) should show the corresponding new snippet creation form. For example:
- If a user drags and drops a text snippet, then we need to show the text snippet form (click on + new snippet > text to see this)
- if a user drags and drops a photo, then we need to show the photo snippet form (click on + new snippet > photo to see this) 
- and so on.. 

7) Clicking on a URL in a URL snippet type (green color) should open the link in a new tab.
(Make sure to implement this for Mobile and tablet as well)

Specific changes for Mobile and tablet:
8) Tapping the vertical ellipsis in mobile version of the prototype shows the menu but the clickable area is very small and sometimes it doesn't show the menu due to this issue. Also we see similar issue when the user clicks on "hamburger" (menu icon) and they click on "vertical ellipsis" icon - the clickable area is very small, increase the tappable area, so we are able to easily tap the "vertical ellipsis" icon to view the menu in it!

9) The filter seems broken. If it select just "URL" and hit "Done", it shows just the URL item but if I touch that item or scroll or anything, I see a bunch of other non-URL snippets added to the list...we should show only the items that has been selected in the filter and scrolling should not affect this!

10) When clicking on a stream from the left sidebar, it appears that the app reloads the entire page, we don't want that to happen instead, we are expecting this to have an ajax call to filter the data (or just do it locally on the client) vs a full app reload. When applying filters it works as expected. Perhaps use the hash URI instead of URL parameters so people can still bookmark a specific stream without forcing a full app reload.

11) When using the multi-select option, if I select a few at the top, then scroll down... 
a) I don't see the checkbox to select the lower items - please allow users to select an item/snippet (and make sure even when we load more snippets by scrolling to be bottom, show options to select a snippet)
c) Tagging as favorites (selecting and clicking on star icon) in the multi-select should show the star icon to each of the snippet that was selected (select the star icon for an individual snippet to see where the star is shown when favorites is clicked).

12) If I slide over the snippet, I sometimes see the whole list slide over (see slideover.png)

13) In the left sidebar, we tap on three vertical circles to view the options but not clear on how to close these as it looks like the 3 dots gets hidden, please allow the users to close when 3 dots are tapped again 
- and when a user selects an option in it or when the user closes this menu icon by tappings anywhere on the screen then we should hide these options as well, currently this doesn't seem to hide until we reload the page.

Specific HTML/CSS/JavaScript Requirements:
HTML/CSS Requirements:
- Your HTML code must be valid HTML5 and follow best practices
- Validate your code - reviewers may accept minor validation errors, but please comment your reason for any validation errors. Use the validators listed in the scorecard.
- Use CSS to space out objects, not clear/transparent images (GIFs or PNGs) and use proper structural CSS to layout your page. Only use table tags for tables of data/information and not for page layout.
- No inline CSS styles - all styles must be placed in an external style-sheet.
- Use semantically correct tags - use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.
- Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)
- Label all CSS, JavaScript, or HTML hacks with explanations so others will understand.
- Your code must render properly in all browsers listed in the scorecard in both Mac and PC environments.

JavaScript Requirements:
- All JavaScript used must not have any copyrights to any third party. You are encouraged to use your own scripts, or scripts that are free, publicly available and do not have copyright statements or author recognition requirements anywhere in the code.
- You are allowed to use JQuery (MIT License) for this contest.

Browsers Requirements:
- Internet Explorer 9+  on PC
- Firefox on Mac / PC
- Chrome on Mac / PC
- Safari on Mac
- Safari on iOS
- Chrome on iOS / Android
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Deliverables:
- A complete list of deliverables can be viewed in the UI Prototype Competitions Tutorial.

Final Submission:
- For each member, the final submission should be uploaded to the Online Review Tool.
